title: Frank Zappa - Philly '76 (2009) 2CD (Philadelphia, PA, 1976)
description:
â€œPhilly '76â€ contains a concert held at the â€˜Spectrumâ€™ in Philadelphia on October 29, 1976. This period in Zappa's career is otherwise documented by the album â€œZoot Alluresâ€, and by â€œZappa in New Yorkâ€, drawn from shows recorded two months later.

The difference on this release is the addition of vocalist/keyboardist Bianca Odin, also known as Bianca Thornton and Lady Bianca. Her gospel tinged vocals add much to songs like Dirty Love, Chrissy Puked Twice (known to Zappaphiles as T!tt!es & Beer) and of course, Dinah-Moe Humm. 
Previously heard only on one two-minute track Zappa released in the early 90â€™s on â€˜You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore Vol. 6â€™, her flamboyant soul singing is an unusual flavor in Zappaâ€™s music, even helping Zappa replicate some of the salacious groupie banter previously heard during the â€˜Flo & Eddie daysâ€™ of the Mothers.

Also appearing for the first time on the album are a cover of "Stranded in the Jungle" (originally recorded in 1956 by the Jay Hawks), and a verse of lyrics in "Titties 'N Beer" not included in previously released versions of the song, which illuminates Zappa's original title for the song, "Chrissy Puked Twice."
   

Frank Zappa
